title.value: A Logistics Provider’s Profit Maximization Facility Location
title.justification: This is the title of the research paper.
title.quote: A Logistics Provider’s Profit Maximization Facility Location

extractions.description: This paper addresses a strategic decision-making problem faced by logistics providers seeking to find facility location decisions that lead to profitable operations. The authors propose a stochastic bilevel formulation and a non-conventional single-level mixed integer linear programming formulation. They perform experimental studies to analyze the impact of model parameters on the solutions.

type.justification: The paper mainly proposes a new formulation for a strategic facility location problem and presents algorithms and models, which is characteristic of theoretical research.
type.quote: This paper offers four main contributions. First, we consider a problem of high practical relevance to LPs in general, and to our industrial partner, Purolator, in particular. We offer a first attempt to address this problem that, to the best of our knowledge, has not been studied before. Second, the problem can be naturally modeled with a stochastic bilevel formulation where shippers make decisions according to a random utility maximization model. Noteworthy are the intrinsic and endogenous uncertainty in the LP’s costs due to imperfect knowledge of the shippers’ reactions and their customers’ characteristics. Third, using a simulation-based model approximation and properties of the associated optimal solutions, we propose a non-conventional single-level mixed-integer linear programming reformulation. Fourth, we report an experimental study where we analyze the impact of model parameters on solutions and computing times.

name.justification: The paper is primarily focused on optimization techniques and models pertinent to operation research, specifically within the logistics domain.
name.quote: We propose a stochastic bilevel formulation where a given LP (leader) anticipates the decisions of shippers (followers) arising from a random utility maximization model.

name.justification: The paper deals specifically with the strategic placement of facilities to optimize profit, which is a key area of facility location planning.
name.quote: This work deals with the problem of a given LP seeking to make strategic facility location decisions that lead to profitable operations.

name.justification: The proposed model is a bilevel programming formulation, addressing hierarchical decision-making problems.
name.quote: Closest to our work are studies that deal with both facility location and pricing decisions formulated as bilevel programs (e.g., Dan et al., 2020). These are hierarchical decision-making problems where a leader first takes decisions, anticipating the follower’s reactions (lower-level problem).

name.justification: The shipper's decisions in the paper are modeled using random utility maximization models.
name.quote: Namely, LP makes agreements with shippers but the cost of operations largely depends on characteristics of the shippers’ customers. At a strategic planning level, the LP has imperfect information thereof. Our strategic profit maximization facility location problem has similarities with facility location and pricing problems. Closest to our work are studies that deal with both facility location and pricing decisions formulated as bilevel programs (e.g., Dan et al., 2020). These are hierarchical decision-making problems where a leader first takes decisions, anticipating the follower’s reactions (lower-level problem).
